chat.content: 👋 Welcome to Al Jazeera News Assistant! How would you like to explore the news today?

Region selected: Africa
📰 Now select a topic in Africa:
Topic selected: Politics
🔍 Fetching news for Politics in Africa...

**Gabon swears in ex-military chief Oligui as president**

The former general, who led coup that ended Bongo family’s 55-year rule, swept the elections last month.

[Read More](https://www.aljazeera.com/news/2025/5/3/gabon-swears-in-ex-military-chief-oligui-as-president)

**Protesters denounce Togo leader’s new role as an attempt at indefinite rule**

Protesters in Togo are speaking out against constitutional changes that could keep Faure Gnassingbe in power

[Read More](https://www.aljazeera.com/program/newsfeed/)

**Rebuilding Bangladesh after Sheikh Hasina’s fall**

101 East investigates the downfall of Bangladesh’s ruthless regime and goes inside the fight to reclaim democracy.

[Read More](https://www.aljazeera.com/program/101-east/)

**DRC seeks to lift ex-President Kabila’s immunity over alleged war crimes**

Joseph Kabila denies charges of treason and war crimes amid escalating tensions in volatile eastern provinces.

[Read More](https://www.aljazeera.com/news/2025/5/1/drc-seeks-to-lift-ex-president-kabilas-immunity-over-alleged-war-crimes)

**Uganda’s military chief says holding opposition activist ‘in my basement’**

Opposition leader says Eddie Mutwe’s abduction ‘a reminder to the world’ of breakdown in law and order in Uganda.

[Read More](https://www.aljazeera.com/news/2025/5/2/ugandas-military-chief-says-holding-opposition-activist-in-my-basement)

**Why does DRC want to end ex-President Kabila’s immunity for war crimes?**

The former leader is accused of allying with the rebel M23 group, active in the country’s east.

[Read More](https://www.aljazeera.com/news/2025/5/2/why-does-drc-want-to-end-ex-president-kabilas-immunity-for-war-crimes)

WHO Director General Tedros Adhanom Ghebreyesus says contributions have fallen sharply across the board.

👋 Welcome to Al Jazeera News Assistant! How would you like to explore the news today?
📌 Please select a mode to continue:
I want to ask a custom question
✍️ What would you like to know about the news?
any news on Togo and protesters?

Yes, according to an article on Al Jazeera, protesters in Togo are denouncing constitutional changes that could enable President Faure Gnassingbe to remain in power indefinitely. They see this move as an attempt to extend his rule and are actively speaking out against it. For more details, you can refer to the article here: [Protesters denounce Togo leader’s new role as an attempt at indefinite rule](https://www.aljazeera.com/program/newsfeed/).
